questions.question_text_1: If addition and subtraction are meaningful operation for a variable, then the scale(s) of measurement of the variable could be:
question_texts: If addition and subtraction are meaningful operation for a variable, then the scale(s) of measurement of the variable could be:

options.option_text: Ratio
Nominal
Ordinal
Interval

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements correctly describe Descriptive and Inferential Statistics?
question_texts: Which of the following statements correctly describe Descriptive and Inferential Statistics?

options.option_text: Descriptive statistics uses probability theory to draw conclusions, whileinferential statistics is represented through tables, charts, and graphs.
Inferential statistics involves using sample data to make generalizations orpredictions about a population.
Both descriptive and inferential statistics only deal with numerical data, notcategorical data.
Descriptive statistics involves summarizing data using measures such asmean, median,and standard deviation.
Cross-sectional data are collected at a single point in time across severalindividuals, firms, or regions etc.
Time series data involve observations on a variable measured at a single pointof time.
Nominal scale provides both labelling and meaningful ranking of categories.
Ratio scale has an absolute zero and allows for comparison of both differencesand ratios between observations.

questions.question_text_1: There are 4 observations whose mean is 5 and population variance is 2.5. Two of the observations are known to be 4 and 6. Find the product of the remaining two observations.
